description.value:
Trigger A creature opens the door

Effect The hall is buffeted by powerful winds for as long as the door remains open. A creature must succeed at a @Check[type:athletics|dc:32] check to move toward the door. A creature who fails at this check is pushed back 5 feet and falls @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Prone]{Prone}.

Additionally, the triggering creature is blasted by a powerful gust of wind and must attempt a @Check[type:fortitude|dc:32] save. The trap then rolls initiative.

Critical Success The creature is unaffected.

Success The creature is pushed back 5 feet.

Failure The creature is pushed back 10 feet.

Critical Failure The creature is pushed back 10 feet and knocked @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Prone]{Prone}.

details.description: Magic runes carved into a doorframe connect a door to the Plane of Air when opened, blowing creatures down the connecting hall.
details.disable: @Check[type:thievery|dc:30|name:Scratch Out Runes|traits:action:disable-a-device] (expert) twice to scratch out the runes, or @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Dispel Magic]{Dispel Magic} (5th level; counteract DC 30) to counteract the planar runes; @Check[type:athletics|dc:32|name:Shut the Door] to shut the door if it's open (using Athletics only stops the trap, it doesn't fully disable it)
details.routine: (1 action) The trap uses 1 action to blow powerful winds down the hall. Each creature in the hall must attempt a @Check[type:fortitude|dc:32] save with the same results as Gust. If this forced movement would cause a creature to collide with a solid object or fall downstairs or out a window, that creature takes an additional [[/r (2d10 + 11)[bludgeoning]]] damage (or [[/r 20[bludgeoning]]] damage due to a fall).
